moves.1. e3: This is a training game with me and a new player to my over-the-board club! We live in neighbouring villages! I am annotating it to help him learn!
moves.1... e5: e3 is not a bad opening move. It makes it hard for black to attack f2, and prepares to develop the Bf1.
moves.2. b3: This is not a bad follow-up either.
moves.3. Bb2: He continues to develop - this is the logical follow-up to his previous move.
moves.4. c4: This is a good move, chipping away on the black centre.
moves.5. cxd5: Taking isn't bad, but I think it improves black's position more than white, as now Nb8 can go to c6.
moves.6. Qe2: This is a truly dreadful move. It blocks the diagonal for the bishop. White shouldn't be thinking of developing the queen so early. Instead 6. Nc3 and Bb4+ have been played before.
moves.6... Nc6: I play the knight out - partly because it is good development, but also because he was threatening to come to b5 with check.
moves.7. Qb5: He goes to b5 anyway. Although the computer doesn't give it as a mistake, I think it is. He really needs to develop his knights and Bf1.
moves.8. a3: Again not given as a mistake by the computer, but I think it is - he needs to develop his knights and Bf1.
moves.8... O-O: I get my king to safety.
moves.9. h4: This is not given as a mistake by the computer, but I think it is. He really needs to develop his knights and Bf1
moves.9... Qc7: I want to move Bc8 without losing b7.
moves.10. b4: Yet another wasted move in my view!
moves.10... Bd7: Now I am threatening to move my Nc6, opening up the diagonal for my Bd7 and so attacking his queen.
moves.11... d4: I try to open up the centre to his king.
moves.12. e4: Computer says this is a mistake, but there is some logic in trying to keep the centre blocked with his king in the centre.
moves.12... Kh8: Computer doesn't like this move. I am preparing f7-f5
moves.13. g4: White is still trying to attack before developing!
moves.13... Ng6: Computer doesn't like this move, but I think it is good, heading for f4.
moves.14. d3: I think Nh3 is better, preventing my next.
moves.15. Qf3: Qd1 or even Qd2 was better, allowing f2-f3, defending the g pawn.
moves.15... Qc8: I put an additional attack on the g pawn. Computer prefers Nxb4
moves.16. Ne2: At last he develops a knight! Well done!
moves.17... f5: I return to my older plan. Computer still likes Nxb4.
moves.19... fxe4: I take, with the plan that 20. f3xg4 is met with e3+ and 21. Kxd3 is met with e5-e4+ opening up the diagonal for my Bd6 to his queen on g3.
moves.20. fxe4: But he takes this way instead.
moves.20... Nxb2: I take, although computer points out that Rf3 is stronger.
moves.21. Bh3: This is an excellent defensive move, trying to exchange my attacking pieces, but it is too late.
moves.22... Bxb4+: I take with check. His king has no squares, he is forced to block with a knight.
moves.23. Nbc3: He at last develops the knight!
moves.24. Nxc3: He takes back. He is lost!
moves.25. Qxc3: This is a mistake, in a lost position.
moves.25... Rf2+: I played this to win the queen.
moves.26. Ke1: Now I see a way of winning the king instead!
moves.26... Re2+: This check drives the king onto the f file.
moves.28... Qf2#: And now mate finished him off! Many thanks for reading this, please rate it on the star system and leave a comment or two!
